page.title: 05-All Saints Church, Chilton-
page.content: The nave dates back to the 12th. century.The south aisle and chancel were added by the 14th. century. The tower and porch were built in 1847, but unfortunately the 6 bell peal has not been rung since 1959 due to the weakness of the tower.2 gargoyles were stolen a few years ago.One was found and the other was probably sold. The first vicar was Philip Bassett- 1270-1275.Nowadays the Rector of Harwell is responible for the services- about 7 a month. 2 wardens look after the church and churchyard.They attend weddings, burials and parish meetings.They are also responsible for the care of the hymn,prayer and psalm books,and bibles. The churchyard is still used for burials.The Brooker table-tomb is believed to be the oldest dated tomb stone in this country-1551.
